sense.def:
A stamp
ali
a postage stamp
je košček papirja, namazan z lepilom, ki ga prilepimo na pisemsko ovojnico ali paket, preden ga oddamo in tako dokažemo, da smo plačali zahtevano poštnino.

A stamp
je tudi košček lesa ali kovine, na katerem so vrezane besede ali vzorec. Pritisnemo ga na blazinico, napojeno s črnilom, in potem na listino, da na njej ostane znamenje. Tudi tako znamenje imenujemo
a stamp
.

seg.quote: They had German passports with Brazilian entrance stamps.

sense.def:
To stamp a mark or word on an object
pomeni pritisniti znak ali besedo na predmet s štampiljko ali kakšno drugo pripravo.

seg.quote: Articles that conform with the relevant British Standards are stamped with a kite-shaped mark.
Unless pots are stamped ‘ovenproof’ assume they are not.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
bears the stamp of a particular quality or person
, ima jasno izraženo določeno kakovost ali ga je izdelala določena oseba.

seg.quote: His work hardly bore the stamp of maturity.

sense.def:
To stamp one's foot
pomeni zelo trdo položiti stopalo na tla, ker smo jezni.

cit.quote: zacepetati, udariti z nogo ob tla

seg.quote: ‘Damn you, Edward!’ she shouted, stamping her foot.

sense.def:
To stamp on something
pomeni zelo trdo položiti stopalo na nekaj.

seg.quote: I stamped heavily on her foot and muttered, ‘Shut up.’

sense.def:
To stamp something out
pomeni nekaj končati.

seg.quote: They are determined to stamp out political extremism.
